description: A small island near Water 7 where the Thousand Sunny is docked. It serves as the location where Franky officially joins the Straw Hat Pirates.

keyEvents.eventTitle: Franky Arrives at the Thousand Sunny
keyEvents.description: Franky catches up to his swim briefs at the Thousand Sunny docked on Scrap Island.

keyEvents.eventTitle: Franky Officially Joins the Straw Hat Pirates
keyEvents.description: On Scrap Island, Franky makes the momentous decision to join the Straw Hat Pirates as their shipwright.

significance: The location where Franky joins the Straw Hat Pirates, marking a pivotal moment in the crew's formation.

description: A major city in the Grand Line known for its shipbuilding industry and unique water-based architecture.

keyEvents.description: Franky causes chaos by running through the streets of Water 7 without his swim briefs.

keyEvents.eventTitle: Emotional Farewell Between Franky and His Family
keyEvents.description: Franky says goodbye to the citizens of Water 7 and the Franky Family as he prepares to depart.

geography.terrain: City built on canals with multiple levels

significance: The home of the Franky Family and the birthplace of the Thousand Sunny. The final episode of the Water 7 Saga takes place here.

description: The second ship of the Straw Hat Pirates, built by Franky and the Galley-La Company using treasure tree Adam. Features a lion figurehead and runs on cola.

keyEvents.eventTitle: Franky Arrives at the Thousand Sunny
keyEvents.description: Franky catches up to his swim briefs at the Thousand Sunny.

keyEvents.eventTitle: Franky Officially Joins the Straw Hat Pirates
keyEvents.description: Franky agrees to join the crew as the shipwright of the Thousand Sunny, recognizing it needs proper care.

geography.terrain: Ship with lawn deck and multiple specialized rooms

significance: The ship Franky built and the vessel that allows him to achieve his dream of sailing on his own creation. Represents the culmination of Tom's teachings.
